016package edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.service;
017
018import android.content.Context;
019import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
020import androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData;
021import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
022import edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.model.domain.Ecosystem;
023import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Completable;
024import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Observable;
025import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Scheduler;
026import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single;
027import io.reactivex.rxjava3.schedulers.Schedulers;
028import io.reactivex.rxjava3.subjects.BehaviorSubject;
029import io.reactivex.rxjava3.subjects.Subject;
030import java.util.Random;
031import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
032import javax.inject.Inject;
033import javax.inject.Singleton;
034
035/**
036 * Manages and choreographs creation of, and subsequent operations performed on (and results
037 * returned from) a simulation involving an instance of {@link Ecosystem}. Any mutation operations
038 * performed on an ecosystem should be coordinated through an instance of this class, <em>not</em>
039 * by direct invocation of mutator methods on the {@code Ecosystem} instance itself.
040 */
041@Singleton
042public class EcosystemRepository {
043
044  private static final String NO_ECOSYSTEM_OR_ABSORBING = "Ecosystem has not been created, or is already in the absorbing state (in which no further simulation is meaningful).";
045
046  private final Random rng;
047  private final Scheduler scheduler;
048  private final MutableLiveData<Ecosystem> ecosystem;
049  private final MutableLiveData<Boolean> running;
050
051  private Subject<Integer> ticker;
052
053  @Inject
054  EcosystemRepository(@ApplicationContext Context context, Random rng) {
055    this.rng = rng;
056    scheduler = Schedulers.single();
057    ecosystem = new MutableLiveData<>();
058    running = new MutableLiveData<>();
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Creates and returns a {@link Single Single&lt;Ecosystem&gt;} which&mdash;when subscribed
063   * to&mdash;creates an instance of {@link Ecosystem} and updates the value in the
064   * {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Ecosystem&gt;} container returned by {@link #getEcosystem()}.
065   * <ul><li>The ecosystem terrain will be populated with approximately equal numbers of each
066   * breed, with the total number of breeds specified by {@code numBreeds}.</li>
067   * <li>The ecosystem's terrain is a lattice or grid, with height and width specified by
068   * {@code size}, and with each cell occupied by an individual of one of the breeds.</li>
069   * <li>The terrain may be thought of as a square box with closed
070   * sides, or as a torus with wrapping edges, depending on the value of the {@code toroidal}
071   * parameter.</li></ul>
072   *
073   * @param numBreeds Initial number of breeds inhabiting the terrain of the ecosystem.
074   * @param size      Height and width of the terrain.
075   * @param toroidal  Flag specifying whether the terrain is a torus ({@code true}) or box
076   *                  ({@code false}.
077   * @return {@link Single Single&lt;Ecosystem&gt;} that can be subscribed to, to create an
078   * {@link Ecosystem}.
079   */
080  public Single<Ecosystem> create(int numBreeds, int size, boolean toroidal) {
081    clearTicker();
082    return Single.fromSupplier(() -> new Ecosystem(numBreeds, size, toroidal, rng))
083        .subscribeOn(scheduler)
084        .doOnSuccess(ecosystem::postValue);
085  }
086
087  /**
088   * Creates and returns an {@link Observable Observable&lt;Integer&gt;} which&mdash;when subscribed
089   * to&mdash;starts execution of the ecosystem simulation.
090   * <ul><li>Each {@code onNext} event of the {@code Observable} consists of an invocation of
091   * {@link Ecosystem#iterate(int, float) Ecosystem.iterate(iterationsPerBatch, swapProbability)}.
092   * </li>
093   * <li>The value passed to the subscribing
094   * {@link io.reactivex.rxjava3.functions.Consumer Consumer&lt;Integer&gt;} is the number of
095   * iterations in the batch in which a competitive interaction resulted in replacement of the
096   * losing individual by a copy of the winning individual.</li>
097   * <li>At the end of each batch of iterations, if the ecosystem has reached the absorbing state
098   * (in which only a single breed is surviving), the {@code onComplete} event is triggered
099   * automatically.</li></ul>
100   *
101   * @param iterationsPerBatch         Iterations of the simulation executed for each
102   *                                   {@code onNext}.
103   * @param swapProbability            Probability that a randomly selected pair is swapped at the
104   *                                   start of each iteration.
105   * @param millisecondsBetweenBatches Milliseconds by which each batch of iterations follows
106   *                                   completion of the previous batch.
107   * @return {@link Observable Observable&lt;Integer&gt;} that can be subscribed to, to start
108   * execution of the simulation.
109   * @throws IllegalStateException If the {@link Ecosystem} has not yet been created, or if it is
110   *                               already in the absorbing state.
111   */
112  public Observable<Integer> run(
113      int iterationsPerBatch, float swapProbability, int millisecondsBetweenBatches)
114      throws IllegalStateException {
115    if (ecosystem.getValue() == null || ecosystem.getValue().isAbsorbed()) {
116      throw new IllegalStateException(NO_ECOSYSTEM_OR_ABSORBING);
117    }
118    clearTicker();
119    ticker = BehaviorSubject.createDefault(0);
120    running.postValue(true);
121    return ticker
122        .subscribeOn(scheduler)
123        .doOnTerminate(() -> {
124          ticker = null;
125          running.postValue(false);
126        })
127        .delay(millisecondsBetweenBatches, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS)
128        .map((ignored) -> tick(iterationsPerBatch, swapProbability));
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Creates and returns a {@link Completable} which&mdash;when subscribed to&mdash;pauses execution
133   * of the simulation. As a result of pausing the simulation, the {@code onComplete} event is
134   * triggered for the {@link Observable Observable&lt;Integer&gt;} returned by the
135   * {@link #run(int, float, int)} method.
136   *
137   * @return {@link Completable} that can be subscribed to, to pause execution of the simulation.
138   */
139  public Completable pause() {
140    return Completable.fromAction(this::clearTicker)
141        .subscribeOn(scheduler);
142  }
143
144  /**
145   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Ecosystem&gt;} containing the current
146   * ecosystem.
147   */
148  public LiveData<Ecosystem> getEcosystem() {
149    return ecosystem;
150  }
151
152  /**
153   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Boolean&gt;} containing a flag indicating
154   * whether the simulation is running or paused.
155   */
156  public LiveData<Boolean> getRunning() {
157    return running;
158  }
159
160  private void clearTicker() {
161    if (ticker != null && !ticker.hasComplete()) {
162      ticker.onComplete();
163    }
164  }
165
166  private int tick(int numIterations, float swapProbability) {
167    Ecosystem ecosystem = this.ecosystem.getValue();
168    //noinspection DataFlowIssue
169    int changes = ecosystem.iterate(numIterations, swapProbability);
170    if (changes > 0) {
171      this.ecosystem.postValue(ecosystem);
172    }
173    if (ecosystem.isAbsorbed()) {
174      clearTicker();
175    } else if (ticker != null && !ticker.hasComplete()) {
176      ticker.onNext(0);
177    }
178    return changes;
179  }
180
181}
